Given a convex polygon with 6 sides, its first 5 interior angles are: 78.0°, 103.0°, 72.0°, 131.0°, 94.0°. What is the measure of the remaining interior angle (in degrees)?Return only the angle as your answer.Do not give the units in your answer.
results.full_model_response:
<think>The sum of the interior angles of a hexagon is (6-2)*180 = 720°. The sum of the given angles is 78 + 103 + 72 + 131 + 94 = 478°. The missing angle is 720° - 478° = 242°.</think>
<answer>242</answer>

A convex polygon has 5 sides. The measures of the first 4 interior angles are: 23.0°, 141.0°, 133.0°, 104.0°. Find the measure of the last interior angle.Return only the angle as your answer.Do not give the units in your answer.
results.full_model_response:
<think>The sum of the interior angles of a 5-sided polygon is (5-2)*180 = 540°. The given angles add up to 23 + 141 + 133 + 104 = 401°. Subtracting from 540° gives 540 - 401 = 139°.</think>
<answer>139</answer>

<answer>72.0</answer>
